Class InputReader

java.lang.Object
  InputReader

public class InputReader
extends java.lang.Object

InputReader reads typed text input from the standard text terminal. The text typed by a user is then chopped into words.

Version:
1.5 (2012.11.29)
Author:
Michael KÃ¶lling and David J. Barnes

          Create a new InputReader that reads text from the text terminal.

Method Detail

convertToInt

public int convertToInt(java.lang.String word)
Convert the given word to an integer. Assumes the word really contains just integer characters.

Parameters:
word - The word to be converted.
Returns:
The integer represented by word.
Throws:
java.lang.NumberFormatException - if word is not an integer.

getInput

public java.lang.String[] getInput()
Read a line of text from standard input (the text terminal), and return it as an array of words.

Returns:
A set of Strings, where each String is one of the words typed by the user

isAnInt

public boolean isAnInt(java.lang.String word)
Return true if the given word is an integer, false otherwise.

Parameters:
word - A possible integer string.
Returns:
true if word is an int.
